trends: There have been no other sightings in between Monroe and Geno
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: we were traveling west on Hwy 22 shortly after sunset noticed what we thought a well lighted semi traveling the river valley in a northeasterly direction.
divs: sighting detailsat that time i was unfamiliar with a new intersection due to road construction on hwy 39. not knowing where it would intersect with 22 i was traveling slower, thinking i would intersect this truck in a few minutes in this unknown intersection! so we were watching closely because of it being dusk and oncoming traffic and not sure of where we would meet. except it became apparent it was not on a road and it was not a truck! the picture i saw that drew me to this site was very much similar to what we saw but, the lights that run across the mid-section in the picture had only one or 2 areas being lit. what we saw had all the double row of windows? fully lit. you could see inside the craft but no activity was seen inside thru the windows unfortunately (we felt they were window panes of some sort because we could distinguish depth ~ looking into some type of vehicle...as it passed directly in front of us. no sound, no wings, and motating at about 35 to 50 mph not like it was in a landing mode but in an even flight path (it was not a hot air balloon!) we never took our eyes off of it from the minute we saw it and watched it about 15-17 minutes totally..originally from when we thought it was a semi-truck! it was only flying up to 40' above the ground if that! so in the valley it appeared to be on a road...i have always been looking at the ufo pics and only seen one or 2 things that came close to it! we knew there were 2 cars behind us and 3 oncoming and noone mentioned it to media whatso ever including our selves! but i was glad there was 2 of us in my car so i can attest we were not hallucinating! we found our turn off shortly taking a spur they had at that time to connect to 39 and travel to albion... we could see it for a short while glimpsing it only one other time due to the road dipping down into valleys...it continued on in a northeasterly fashion...i would be nice to know what it was! since we saw it so up close and personal...it remains a mystery to us after all of this time! http:\\www.coasttocoastam.com\photo\42966
